title: Don't Make Me Think
author: Steve Krug
description: Web designers and developers alike have rely on, usability guru, Steve Krug’s guide to help them understand the principles of intuitive navigation and information design.

title: The User Experience Team of One
author: Leah Buley
description: Whether you want to cross over into user experience or you're a seasoned practitioner trying to move your organization forward, this book gives you tools and insight for doing more with less.

title: 100 Things Every Designer Needs to Know About People
author: Susan Weinschenk
description: With this book you’ll design more intuitive and engaging apps, software, websites and products that match the way people think, decide and behave.

title: Start With Why
author: Simon Sinek
description: Start With Why shows that the leaders who've had the greatest influence in the world all think, act, and communicate the same way – and it's the opposite of what everyone else does.

title: Jab, Jab, Jab, Right Hook
author: Gary Vaynerchuk
description: A mash-up of Gary Vaynerchuk's best elements of Crush It! and The Thank You Economy with a fresh spin, this book is a blueprint to social media marketing strategies that really work.

title: HTML and CSS
author: John Duckett
description: HTML and CSS: Design and Build Websites introduces website design in a way that makes it accessible to everyone. This educational book is one that you will enjoy picking up, reading, then referring back to.

title: JavaScript and JQuery
author: John Duckett
description: JavaScript and JQuery: Interactive Front-End Web Development will show you how to make your websites more interactive and your interfaces more interesting and intuitive.
